alert.note: Alert for Northern Will; Southern Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 26 at 2:45PM CDT until May 27 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING THROUGH 7 AM CDT FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...DuPage, Grundy, Kane, Kendall, Northern Will and Southern Will counties * WHEN...From 7 PM CDT this evening through 7 AM CDT Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Slow-moving or nearly stationary showers and thunderstorms will result in localized rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour and may lead to localized pockets of flash flooding tonight.
info.instruction: A Flood Watch for flash flooding means rapid-onset flooding is possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Flash flooding is a dangerous situation. Persons with interests along area rivers, creeks, and other waterways should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
